intro: Couepia floccosa, commonly known as the woolly couepia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Couepia floccosa is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
